message_1: What is the minimum number of crossings required to untangle the Borromean rings, a well-known topological symbol composed of three interlocked circles, such that they are no longer linked?
message_2: The minimum number of crossings required to untangle the Borromean rings is 1. By changing the crossing of one of the rings, the other two rings will be unlinked, and the entire configuration will no longer be interlocked.
